intro: Pseudodracontium lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pseudodracontium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
